page.title: 11A SUNDAY LUNCH IN DARLINGTON
page.content:
This is a typical Sunday lunch. Roast Beef Roast or Baked Potatoes Garden Peas Carrots Yorkshire Puddings
A RECIPE OF YORKSHIRE PUDDINGS. Put 100g of sieved flour with a pinch of salt in a bowl. Make a dip in the centre of flour and into this drop two eggs. Mix in the flour with the eggs. Then add slowly 250ml of milk, beating gently with a wooden spoon. Add a tablespoonful of water. Beat this mixture until bubbles form. Cover and leave for an hour. Heat up some dripping in a fairly deep meat tin. Pour in the batter and quickly take to oven to cook at 230deg C.
